body: Hi Kyle, For energy modeling you need to subdivide surface to sub-surfaces. Honeybee has a component that helps you with that however you can do similar operations using Grasshopper native components. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/N7*qQ6E0U5LYedoJPtbaVy6iKhgvhrB1gWq8Mc-kpHuiVcHRaRiE-S5GdegepjgoA3MmNJ3JUapEn59O-S77iB*coqhDI58d/intersectMasses.png) Check the attached file for a slightly modified file. I connected 2 zones so you can see how it works. Do NOT graft the zones randomly. you want all the zones to go through solveAdjacency in the same branch. Mostapha
